headline: GI Alliance joins forces with Cardinal Health to enhance support for physicians
summary: The transaction, valuing GIA at $3.9bn, will create a multi-speciality managed services platform.

headline: Cardinal Health expands gastroenterology, diabetes businesses with two deals worth $3.9 billion
summary: Cardinal Health said it would buy a 71% stake in GIA from a combination of physician owners and funds managed by affiliates of Apollo Global Management for about $2.8 billion in cash, expanding into gastroenterology.  The group will buy ADSG, which home delivers diabetes supplies, for about $1.1 billion from private equity firm Court Square Capital Partners in a deal that will expand its at-home solutions business.

raw.headline: Cardinal Health expands gastroenterology, diabetes businesses with two deals worth $3.9 billion
raw.summary: Cardinal Health said it would buy a 71% stake in GIA from a combination of physician owners and funds managed by affiliates of Apollo Global Management for about $2.8 billion in cash, expanding into gastroenterology.  The group will buy ADSG, which home delivers diabetes supplies, for about $1.1 billion from private equity firm Court Square Capital Partners in a deal that will expand its at-home solutions business.

headline: Cardinal Health announces two strategic additions to its portfolio
summary: Cardinal Health (NYSE: CAH) announced today that it has entered into definitive agreements to acquire two companies that accelerate Cardinal Health's strategic growth areas and that will enhance patient care. The company also provided confirmation of its capital deployment plans.
